alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; New Kent; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 1:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Chesterfield, northwestern Charles City, northwestern New Kent, southeastern Henrico, southeastern Hanover and southwestern King William Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 134 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chester, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hopewell, Talleysville, Roxbury, Chester, Highland Springs, Tunstall, Bottoms Bridge, Bellwood, Wrights Corner, Orapax Farms, Elko, Sandston, Glendale, Westwood, Richmond International, Quinton, Fair Oaks, Lanesville, Meadowville and Browns Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central, south central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; New Kent; Western King William
